name: Rails Beginner Cheatsheet
tagline: A cheat sheet for rails beginners, taking care of a lot of basic stuff and information. Aimed at helping beginners too look up stuff. Originally created for my RailsGirls project group.
body:
# A little cheat sheet **Bold** things are what is really important e.g. the command or whatever is directly associated with the command. _Italic_ things are their arguments. And things in brackets are optional :-) This will hopefully eventually become a github page and a PDF! ## console basics
Concept Usage Example Description
Change directory cd directory

cd my_app

cd my_app/app/controllers

 Changes the directory to the specified directory on the console
List contents directory

list (directory)

Windows: dir (directory)

ls

ls my_app

 Shows all contents (files and folders) of the directory. If no directory is specified shows the contents of the current directory.
Directory you are currently in pwd pwd Shows the full path of the directory you are currently in. E.g./home/tobi/railsgirls
## Ruby Basics
Concept Usage Example Description
Array []

[]

["Rails", "fun", 5]

 Creates an Array, empty or with the specified contents. An empty is a collection of things indexed with numbers.
Acces array an_array[number]

an_array = ["Helau", "Mooo", "zoooo"]

an_array[0] --> "Helau"

an_array[2] --> "zoooo"

 As an Array is a collection of different elements, you often want to access a single element of this Array. Arrays are indexed by numbers, you can use that number to access an individual element. Be aware that the numbering actually starts 0 so the first element actually is the 0th. And the last element of a 3 element array is element number 2.
Assigning Array Values an_array[number] = "new value"

an_array = ["Helau", "Mooo", "zoooo"]

an_array[2] --> "Oh I'm all new"

an_array --> ["Helau", "Mooo", "Oh I'm all new"]

 Assigning new Array Values works a lot like accessing them, you just add an equals sign and a new value et voila you changed an element of the array! Weehuuuuu!
